tuv.seg: Relish the Moment
享受当下
Tucked away in our subconsciousness is an idyllic vision.
我们的潜意识里藏着一派田园诗般的风光。
We see ourselves on a long trip that spans the continent.
我们置身在一场横贯大陆的长途旅程中。

We are travelling by train. Out the windows, we drink in the passing scene of cars on nearby highways, of children waving on a crossing, of cattle grazing on a distant hillside, of smoke pouring from a power plant, of row upon row of corn and wheat, of flatlands and valleys, of mountains and rolling hillsides, of city skylines and village halls.
我们乘着火车，欣赏窗外变幻的景色：高速公路上奔驰的汽车、十字路口招手的孩子、远山上吃草的牛群、从电厂滚滚排出的烟尘、成片的玉米和小麦、平原与山谷、群山与绵延起伏的丘陵、天空映衬下城市的轮廓线，以及乡间的土坡。
But the uppermost in our minds is the final destination.
然而在我们心里最重要的却是最终的目的地。
On a certain day at a certain hour, we will pull into the station.
在某一天的某一时刻, 我们将会抵达进站。
Bands will be playing and flags waving.
迎接我们的将是乐队和飘舞的彩旗。
Once we reach there, so many wonderful dreams will come true and the pieces of our lives will be fit together like a completed jigsaw puzzle.
一旦到了那里，许多美梦将变成现实, 我们的生活也将变得完整, 像一张拼好了的拼图。
How restlessly we pace the aisles, damning the minutes loitering, waiting, waiting, waiting for the station.
于是我们现在在过道里不安地踱来踱去, 咒骂时间的缓慢。我们期盼着, 期盼着, 期盼着进站的那一刻。
"When we reach the station, that will be it", we cry.
“当我们到站时，一切都好了！”我们呼喊着。

"When I'm 18", "When I buy a new 450SL Mercedes Benz", "When I put my last kid through collage", "When I have paid off the mortgage", "When I get a promotion", "When I reach the age of the retirement, I shall live happily ever after."
“当我十八岁的时候！”“当我买了一辆崭新的奔驰450SL的时候！”“当我最小的孩子上完大学的时候！”“当我还清贷款的时候！”“当我升官的时候！”“当我退休过上幸福生活的时候！”
Sooner or later, we must realize that there is no station, no one place to arrive at once and for all.
不久的以后，我们终将会意识到人生的旅途并没有车站, 也没有能够一到永逸的地方。
The true joy of life is the trip. The station is only a dream. It constantly outdistances us.
生活的真正乐趣在于旅行的过程, 车站只不过是个梦, 它一直遥遥领先于我们。
"Relish the moment" is a good motto, especially when coupled withe the Psalm 118:24: "This is the day which the Lord hath made, we will rejoice and be glad in it."
“享受当下"是句很好的箴言, 尤其是当它与《圣经·诗篇》中第118页24行中一段话相对应的时候："今日乃主所创造；生活在今日我们将欢欣、高兴。
It isn't the burdens of today that drive men mad. It is the regrets over yesterday and the fear of tommorrow.
"真正令人发疯的不是今日的负担, 而是对昨日的悔恨及对明日的恐惧。
Reget and fear are twin thieves who rob us of today.
悔恨与恐惧是一对孪生的窃贼, 将今天从你我身边掠走。
So stop pacing the aisles and counting the miles.
所以停止在过道里徘徊, 别老计算着离车站还有多远。
Instead, climb more mountains, eat more icecreams, go barefoot more often, swim more rivers, watch more sunsets, laugh more and cry less.
相反， 攀登更多的高山， 多吃点儿冰淇淋, 多光着脚走走, 游更多的河, 多看看夕阳西下, 多点欢声笑语, 少点泪水苦涩。
Life must be lived as we go along.
生活要且行且珍惜。
Then the station will come soon enough.
车站很快就会到达。
